body.text: This open source sample application is built using the [webex-node-bot-framework](https://github.com/jpjpjp/webex-node-bot-framework), which abstracts away some of the complexity of calling the Webex APIs.

The [README](https://github.com/jpjpjp/webex-card-school/blob/master/README.md) for this app provides more information for developers who are interested in understanding the specifics of this app, but in a nutshell, the framework provides our app with a `bot` object each time our bot is added to a space.  The app logic can then call helper methods like `bot.say()` to send messages to the appropriate space.

For sending a card, our app can call `bot.sendCard()` and simply pass the card's JSON design, which could be copied directly from the designer, abstracting away the need to build a full `attachments` array. While this framework is a handy option for node.js developers, the lessons in this bot will primarily cover the pure API approach, while still calling out where this app's code might be slightly different.
